search

Class BestFirstFrontier

  • java.lang.Object
    • search.BestFirstFrontier
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    EditableFrontier, Frontier

    public class BestFirstFrontier
extends java.lang.Object
implements EditableFrontier
    A Frontier that implements the concept of providing the "best" node among those in the frontier as it's next output node. "Best" is defined by reference to a NodeFunction which provides a value for any given node.
    Author:
    Simon Campbell

      void clear()
      Clears the contents of a frontier so that it becomes empty.
      int getMaxFrontierSize()
      A method that returns the maximum number of nodes stored on the frontier since the frontier was created
      boolean isEmpty()
      Checks whether the frontier is empty
      Node remove()
      If the frontier is not empty, this method removes the next node from the frontier.
      Node remove(State state)
      If the frontier is not empty, and contains a node with the provide State as its terminus, the node is removed.

      • remove

        public Node remove(State state)
        Description copied from interface: EditableFrontier
        If the frontier is not empty, and contains a node with the provide State as its terminus, the node is removed. If there are multiple copies of the state in the frontier only one is removed. Otherwise, returns null.
        Specified by:
        remove in interface EditableFrontier
        Parameters:
        state - - the state to find in the frontier and remove
        Returns:
        the Node removed
